gobblin.metastore

Class MysqlStateStore<T extends State>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.metastore.MysqlStateStore<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - state object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateStore<T>

    public class MysqlStateStore<T extends State>
extends Object
implements StateStore<T>
    An implementation of StateStore backed by MySQL.

    This implementation stores serialized States as a blob in the database in the Sequence file format. The database table row is keyed by the store name and table name. State keys are state IDs (see State.getId()), and values are objects of State or any of its extensions. Keys will be empty strings if state IDs are not set (i.e., State.getId() returns null). In this case, the get(String, String, String) method may not work.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • MysqlStateStore

        public MysqlStateStore(DataSource dataSource,
                       String stateStoreTableName,
                       boolean compressedValues,
                       Class<T> stateClass)
                throws IOException
        Manages the persistence and retrieval of State in a MySQL database
        Parameters:
        dataSource - the DataSource object for connecting to MySQL
        stateStoreTableName - the table for storing the state in rows keyed by two levels (store_name, table_name)
        compressedValues - should values be compressed for storage?
        stateClass - class of the States stored in this state store
        Throws:
        IOException
